Developer: Snapshot builds of plugins that had dependencies on other snapshot builds were not having their version numbers compared correctly.
Do not attempt to find the next occurrence of an impossible date such as June 31st in validation of trigger schedules.
Remoting 3.5: Stability improvements.
Remove invalid translations in Slovene.
Remoting 3.5: Add option to specify the Remoting protocol to use on the client.
Use of the remote API to create items in views (<tt>/view/…/createItem</tt>) didn't actually add items to views since Jenkins 2.22.
Remoting 3.5: Remoting clients now accept lowercase (HTTP 2) headers sent by reverse proxies.
Windows service restart did not retain build queue.
Display an informative message, rather than a Groovy exception, when View#getItems fails.
Don't try to set Agent Port when it is enforced, breaking form submission.
Don't add all group names as HTTP headers on "access denied" pages, possibly breaking reverse proxies due to very large headers.
Fix handling of the POST flag in ManagementLinks within the Manage Jenkins page.
IllegalStateException from Winstone when making certain requests with access logging enabled.
Do not fail to write a log file just because something deleted the parent directory.
Important security fixes.
Support displaying of warnings from the update site in the plugin manager and in administrative monitors.
Correctly state that Jenkins will refuse to load plugins whose dependencies are not satisfied in plugin manager.
The <tt>install-plugin</tt> CLI command now correctly installs plugins when multiple file arguments are specified.
Prevent the ClassNotFoundException: javax.servlet.ServletException error when invoking shell tasks on remote agents.
Properties were not passed to Maven command by Maven build step when the Inject Build Variables flag was not set.
Job configuration submission now does not fail when there is no parameters property.
Update Remoting to 3.4 in order to properly terminate the channel in the case Errors and Exceptions.
Check for Updates button in the Plugin Manager was hidden in the Updates tab when there was no plugins updates available.
SSHD Module: Handshake was failing (wrong shared secret) 1 out of 256 times due to SSHD-330.
Performance: Use bulk change when submitting Job configurations to minimize the number of sequential config.xml write operations.
Jobs were hanging during process termination on the Solaris 11 Intel platform, regression in 2.20.
Restore option value for setting build result to unstable when loading shell and batch build steps from disk.

Update to Winstone 3.2 to support ad-hoc certificate generation on Java 8 (using unsupported APIs). This option is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. We strongly recommend you create self-signed certificates yourself and use --httpsKeyStore and related options instead.

lts_changes.message: Upgrade Remoting to version 3.1 with JNLP4-connect protocol. Compatibility notes are available here. Notably, it is no longer possible to use JDK 6 for the Maven project type, as communication with the Maven process uses Remoting, and it now requires Java 7.
Show notification with popup on most pages when administrative monitors are active.
Allow disabling/enabling administrative monitors on Configure Jenkins form.
Ask for confirmation before canceling/aborting runs.
Prompt user whether to add the job to the current view.
Allow CommandInterpreter build steps to set a build result as Unstable via the return code. Shell and Batch build steps now support this feature.
Internal: Upgrade Stapler library from 1.243 to 1.246 with fixes required for the Blue Ocean project. Changes are listed here.

changes.message: Prevent early deallocation of process references by Garbage Collector when starting a remote process. It was sometimes causing build failures with messages like FATAL: Invalid object ID 184 iuota=187 and java.lang.Exception: Object was recently deallocated.
Redirect to login page in the case of authorisation error when checking connectivity to the Update Center.
WinP 1.24: Native class now tries loading DLLs from the temporary location.
WinP 1.24: WinP sometimes kills wrong processes when using killRecursive(). It was likely impacting process termination on Windows agents and sometimes leading to BSoD.
